00001 #ifndef INTERPOLATE_H
00002 #define INTERPOLATE_H
00003 
00004 /**
00005  * 3d interpolate the value at x, y using the values at (listX, listY) and return
00006  * the result.  pointCount should specify the size of the listX, listY, and
00007  * values lists (other words: how many points will be used to interpolate x,y)
00008  * the algorithm used by this function is a x-point inverse squared distance
00009  * weighted interpolation.  this means:
00010  * distance1 = (x1, y1) - (x, y)
00011  * distance2 = (x2, y2) - (x, y)
00012  * ...
00013  * weight1 = 1/(distance1^2)
00014  * weight2 = 1/(distance2^2)
00015  * ...
00016  * weightvalue1 = weight1 * values[1]
00017  * weightvalue2 = weight2 * values[2]
00018  * ...
00019  * pointvalue = sum(weightvaluesAll) / sum(weight)
00020  */
00021 float interpolate(float x, float y, float *listX, float *listY, float *values, int pointCount=3);
00022 
00023 /**
00024  * estimate the y value at x coordinate targetX, according to the
00025  * line defined by the points (x1, y1) - (x2, y2)
00026  */
00027 float interpolate(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float targetX);
00028 
00029 #endif
